title: Feriana Ferraguzzi
text:
Feriana "Fery" Ferraguzzi (born 20 February 1959) is an Italian <a href="women%27s%20soccer">football</a> <a href="Coach%20%28sports%29">coach</a> and former <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>, who is currently the technical director of <a href="BeNe%20League">BeNe League</a> club <a href="Standard%20Li%C3%A8ge%20%28women%29">Standard Fémina de Liège</a>.
A <a href="box-to-box">box-to-box</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>, Ferraguzzi won two <a href="Serie%20A%20%28women%27s%20football%29">Serie A</a> titles with <a href="SS%20Lazio%20%28women%29">SS Lazio</a> in 1979 and 1980 before accepting a transfer offer from Standard Fémina de Liège of 2,000,000 lire plus accommodation.
An administrative error by Lazio meant that Ferraguzzi moved to Standard Fémina with no transfer fee. Lazio complained to <a href="FIFA">FIFA</a> and got her banned from the national team for two years.
Overall, Ferraguzzi was a member of the <a href="Italy%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Italy women's national football team</a> from 1975 until 1993, and scored Italy's first official World Cup goal in <a href="1991%20FIFA%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">1991</a>. She retired from international football aged 34, after playing in Italy's 1–0 <a href="UEFA%20Women%27s%20Euro%201993">UEFA Women's Euro 1993</a> final defeat to <a href="Norway%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Norway</a>, and being named Player of the Tournament.
